channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13212] Procedure V2 - master Create/Modify/Delete namespace
item.description:
master side, part of HBASE-12439
starts up the procedure executor on the master
and replaces the create/modify/delete namespace handlers with the procedure version.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Are you also planning to cover modify operation on namespace?
Yeah, thanks for pointing it out - update the title and description.
Stephen Yuan Jiang are you working on this, if not can I take this up ?
I discussed about this with Matteo recently. I might take this up if Stephen is not keen on pursuing this.
ok
Srikanth Srungarapu Ashish Singhi I plan to work on this after 1.1 release (mid or late May 2015, if you have time before that, you are welcome to take this.
The patch is ready to be reviewed in https://reviews.apache.org/r/36619/ (note: I removed the generated file in the RB to reduce noise)

-1 core zombie tests. There are 3 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestCacheOnWrite.testStoreFileCacheOnWriteInternals(TestCacheOnWrite.java:274)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestCacheOnWrite.testStoreFileCacheOnWrite(TestCacheOnWrite.java:502)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14949//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14949//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14949//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14949//console

This message is automatically generated.
The patch has nothing to do with the failed and zombie tests

Patch looks good except one q. Matteo also +1'ed.
I think we need two follow ups though:

  • Add some tests for NS creation and table creation to the IT test from HBASE-13470.
  • There is a dependency between table creation / deletion and NS creation / deletion. Specifically, HMaster.createTable() calls ensureNamespaceExists(namespace) which checks the NS to be available and delete namespace checks whether there are no more tables in the namespace. The current patch does not prevent the race conditions, since we do not acquire a shared NS lock before the table create / delete operations. For example for create table we should do this: 
    
 - obtain exclusive table lock 

 - obtain shared NS lock 

 - check NS exists. 

 - execute rest of create table 

 - release locks
I don't think the table operation should have to take the NS lock. that can be done down at the scheduling level (procedure queue)

Enis Soztutar, HBASE-14212 is created for adding IT for NS DDLs.

We don't need shared NS lock in create table. In the race conditions scenario you mentioned - create table DDL while delete namespace (or rollback create namespace) DDL happens at the same time, if both of them pass the pre-condition check (ensureNamespaceExists() is true and no more tables in the namespace). During the procedure execution step, either the creation of the table would fail trying to creating table directory (because the namespace directory does not exist) or the deletion of namespace would fail trying to deleting the namespace directory (because it contains table directory) - not beautiful (because it fails in the middle of procedure and triggered the unhappy rollback path), but we will not create a-table-in-a-non-existing namespace corruption.

Note: due to low frequency of deleting namespace, the chance that we see this race condition is very low.

I don't think the table operation should have to take the NS lock. that can be done down at the scheduling level (procedure queue)

Sure. If we change the per-table level queue into being a hierarchical queue of NS -> table, then it would work.

Note: due to low frequency of deleting namespace, the chance that we see this race condition is very low.

Agreed. It is not high priority.
Forwarding my +1 from RB.
